properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 16 at 6:23AM EST until January 17 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo NY
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow
accumulations of 3 to 6 inches over the Tug Hill, 2 to 4 inches
elsewhere. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill
Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills
approaching 20 below zero.

* WHERE...Oswego county.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM EST Friday.
For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 2 AM to 11 AM EST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The
cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions
are not taken.
properties.instruction:
Periods of snow will result in snow covered roads and limited
visibilities. Slow down and use caution while driving.

Submit snow reports through our website or social media.

This is a potentially dangerous situation to be outdoors. If you
must be outside, be sure to cover all exposed skin. Frostbite can
occur in 30 minutes or less with apparent temperatures of
15 below zero or colder.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 11 AM EST FRIDAY
